page.title: 17Ballantrae - History.
page.content: Old name for the Parish,from old church near confluence of Stinchar and Tig,was Kirkcudbright-Innertig.About 1604 a new church was built near Ard- stinchar Castle and the present name from Gaelic for "village on the shore" was given.The village became a Burgh of Barony 1617.The date of erection of the castle is unknown,certainly complete by early 15th century.It fell into disuse in early 18th century.In 1770,stones from it were used to build the Stinchar bridge,an inn and several houses.It was a seat of a branch of turbulent Kennedy clan,a young chief of which was killed by cousins in 1601 His tomb is in the remains of the 1604 church,called "the auld aisle",in the old graveyard.Present church built c1819.Harbour built 1850,not a great success.First school was a bequest from Charles McNily,died 1730.
